snippet: Now that the coast is clear, the W.N.B.A., which has been around for nearly two decades, has decided to publicly embrace its gay fans. The gesture deserves two slow claps, considering how long it took.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports Of The Times column notes that WNBA is rolling out a marketing strategy aimed at appealing to the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender community; contends that gesture to LGBT fans has come too late to seem heroic, arriving only after the taboo against being gay in professional sports has largely crumbled.
lead_paragraph: Now that the coast is clear, the W.N.B.A., which has been around for nearly two decades, has decided to publicly embrace its gay fans. The gesture deserves two slow claps, considering how long it took.

headline.main: Coast Cleared by Others, W.N.B.A. Finally Finds Its Gay Pride
headline.print_headline: Coast Cleared by Others, W.N.B.A. Finally Finds Its Gay Pride
